snippet: The man who shot the transit officers had been  moving between subway trains, a violation that has often led to bigger arrests, including gun possession.
abstract: Shooting of New York City Police Officers Michael Levay and Lukasz Kozicki by career criminal Peter Jourdan on a Brooklyn subway train took place after the officers caught Jourdan moving between cars and asked for identification; New York Police Dept has long used transit system rule prohibiting subway passengers from walking between cars as a tool to catch suspects engaged in serious crimes like illegal possession of a weapon.

byline.original: By WENDY RUDERMAN and CHRISTOPHER MAAG

lead_paragraph: The man who shot the transit officers had been  moving between subway trains, a violation that has often led to bigger arrests, including gun possession.

headline.seo: 3 New York Police Officers Recovering After Shootings
headline.main: Shooting of Two Officers Began With a Minor Violation Used to Fight Crime
headline.print_headline: Shooting of Two Officers Began With a Minor Violation Used to Fight Crime
